> <OLD>
>
> Quickstride keeps his nose, ears and eyes open for signs of tro=
uble.
Something definitely made him uneasy, yet he could not put his hoof o=
n it.
>
> "I copy you on that Rodimus... I can't figure it out but somethin=
g is
making the mane on my neck stand on end.. Sorta like a horsefly ya can=
't
shake off..."
>
> Tucson acknowledges Rodimus quickly.

<NEW>

=93Yeah, =
I have gotten that feeling before.=94 Rodimus said over the com line to
Qui=
ckstride, =93But we can get this off without a hitch.=94 He chuckled, =93I
=
don=92t see any hordes of Predacons coming down on us. That probably means
=
they haven=92t been watching.=94

While Rodimus said this with the confiden=
ce of a leader, inside he knew that
it was possible. Hydras is smart and Cy=
clonus was as well. It was indeed
difficult to know that the Predacons had =
going on.

> <OLD>
>
> " Thank you for the intel Rodimus. Now I will be abl=
e to keep my sensors
open for any wave disturbances. Ususally my sonar syst=
ems only pick up on
solid objects, but there is a chance that fluxuations i=
n energy waves, can
be detected via echolocation. My systems are up and run=
ning now.. But
there's one flaw, that kind of detection system is short ran=
ge. If there's
any disturbances long range, I will not be able to detect th=
em. I will do
the best I can to keep alert."
>
> He rolls on with caution, =
trying not to kick up any dirt, or disturb
anything around him. As tires ro=
ll over uneven ground his trailer rocks
slightly as he tries hard to avoid =
too much movement from it.

<NEW>

=93I understand.=94 Rodimus said over th=
e comlink, clearly confident in Tuscon=92s
abilities. =93I am going radio s=
ilent. Cheetor said that the Preds could hear
him. The sweeps have excellen=
t hearing, and who knows what Hydras has built
out there.=94


> <OLD>
>
> =
"Here is Windlord"said the male by comlink in a private maximal chanel"I'm
=
> ready and in position"
>
> Kup took straing shot and said "Time to have s=
ome fun" he startd to track
> the enemy signature and opened fire against t=
hem


<NEW>

For Kup and Straight Shot, trying to track the sweeps out ther=
e was trying
to track ripples of heat rising on a desert savanna. Target lo=
cks ranged
from fleeting to next to impossible as the sweeps themselves fle=
w through
the the air.

Optical sighting however proved effective as Kup pu=
lled the trigger and with
a light *kuthunk!* he sent an arrow into the air,=
 and then another and
another. Quickly the small volley of arrows flew into=
 the air rising in a
large arc, moving farther and more swiftly then any co=
nventional arrow could
have traveled.

It was difficult to see clearly at t=
his distance (20K) but it was obvious
that at least one of the sweeps was h=
it as one of them began to fall from
the skies, smoke trailing after it. Ho=
wever the other four reacted! Like
bees hows hive had been disturbed, they =
flew around, erratic at first as if
trying to discern the angle of attack, =
and then they began to fly in Kup=92s
direction.

Although they were still =
some kilometers away they were quickly closing the
distance, they began to =
open fire as they closed!

OOC: They sweeps are still several miles away, s=
o the shots are more or less
at long range. Its up to you guys if you want =
to be hit or not.

(TAG)

Preston
